author: world today news
title: Storms: Montmirail hospital flooded, firefighters called 150 times in the Ardennes
text:
Residents with their feet in water and a hospital flooded. This is the toll of the storms that hit the Montmirail area on August 1, report the Marne firefighters.
While 28 residents of the health facility’s nursing home were able to be gathered in an internal multipurpose room, 14 others had to be taken care of in Dormans, Epernay and Aÿ-Champagne. There were no injuries. On the morning of August 2, emergency services are also still carrying out a pumping operation in the Montmirail hospital to avoid technical problems. The crawl spaces are indeed full.
Elsewhere in the Marne commune area, the water rose to more than 1m in some villages. Firefighters carried out around fifty operations, mainly for flooded cellars, but without evacuating any residents. The few power cuts reported around 7pm were fixed around 10pm by Enedis, thanks to the installation of two generators.
In the Ardennes, firefighters were called 150 times on August 1st and intervened in about fifteen municipalities following the bad weather. In Jaudun, Mayor François Garcia explained that 70 mm of rain fell in less than an hour. About fifteen homes were affected. Water levels also rose in other municipalities, including Launois-sur-Vence.

author: anaschwambach
title: Arsenal perde em casa para o West Ham e Liverpool lidera a Premier League
text:
Arsenal perde em casa para o West Ham e Liverpool lidera a Premier League
Soucek e Mavropanos fizeram os gols do jogo; Paquetá saiu machucado
O West Ham venceu o Arsenal por 2 a 0 nesta quinta-feira (28) em partida válida pela 19ª rodada da Premier League. Com esse resultado, o Arsenal caiu para a segunda posição na tabela e o Liverpool, que tinha assumido a liderança provisória na terça-feira (26), permanece líder.
No Emirates Stadium, em Londres, Soucek e Mavropanos fizeram os gols da vitória do West Ham. Os visitantes ainda tiveram chance de aumentar o placar. No fim do jogo, Raya defendeu cobrança de pênalti de Benhrama.
O Arsenal estacionou nos 40 pontos e caiu para a vice-liderança, com dois pontos a menos que o Liverpool. Já o West Ham voltou para a sexta posição com 33 pontos.
Paquetá machucado
O brasileiro Lucas Paquetá teve que sair de campo ainda no primeiro tempo. Antes mesmo da bola rolar, o camisa 10 estava sentindo problemas físicos, mas mesmo assim entrou como titular.
Porém, aos 30 minutos de jogo, Paquetá não aguentou e precisou ser substituído por Benrahma.
Próximos jogos
O Arsenal volta a jogar já no domingo, dia 30, contra o Fulham fora de casa. Já o West Ham entra em campo na terça-feira, dia 2, contra o Brighton.

author: Noah Rishaug
title: Sask. woman bikes across nation to promote mental health legislation | CTV News
text:
While most people spent their summer camping or enjoying time with friends, Jade Dulle was on her bike, cycling from coast to coast. Her journey took her from Prince Rupert, B.C., to St. John’s, Newfoundland.
This cross-country trek was more than just an adventure. Dulle was driven by a mission to advocate for change in how Canada addresses its mental health crisis.
“As someone with lived experience trying to access the mental health system, especially in Saskatchewan, I’ve faced all of the barriers,” said Dulle. “That inspired me to make a difference politically for people with lived experience.”
Dulle documented her journey on TikTok, enduring challenging terrain and harsh weather.
“I had to climb a lot of mountains, face cold frigid temperatures, but it was all worth the journey because this cause means so much to me,” she said.
Get the CTV News app for Saskatoon area breaking news alerts and top stories Her advocacy stems from her personal struggles with mental health and frustrations navigating the system. Mental health coverage in Canada varies by province, and many community services are not universally covered.
To push for change, Dulle launched a petition on the House of Commons website. The petition calls for a national framework that covers psychotherapy, psychological assessments, and long-term mental health supports, aiming to harmonize and modernize mental health legislation.
“So my petition...is advocating for a system that covers psychotherapy sessions, psychological assessments, long-term supports, and updated legislation to support people who voluntarily seek services,” she said.
The petition has nearly 400 signatures and needs 500 to be discussed in the House of Commons. It’s sponsored by NDP MP Gord Johns, who serves as the party’s mental health and harm reduction critic.

author: @gurufocus
title: Bank Financials: Net Interest Margin Grows, Asset Quality Improves | BWFG Stock News
text:
A financial update reveals that the bank's first-quarter outcomes align with prior projections, showcasing a favorable trajectory. A key highlight is the expansion of the Net Interest Margin, which is on the rise even without additional rate reductions from the Federal Reserve.
Another significant development is the contribution of the bank's Small Business Administration (SBA) operations. This segment has started to enhance the financials, and the gain-on-sale income from SBA activities is anticipated to escalate throughout the year.
Additionally, the bank reported notable progress in asset quality. Through the effective resolution of two non-performing credits, the institution's non-performing asset ratio has decreased to 83 basis points. This marks a substantial enhancement in the institution's financial health.
